title: The Agents-Partnerships Paradox
excerpt: As AI agents automate shopping decisions, brands are doubling down on human experiences. Both strategies are responses to the same problem - consumers who've stopped paying attention.

sources.title: Marriott Expands Loyalty Strategy With ICC Cricket Partnership
Starbucks is kicking off 2026 with more brand partnerships
Walmart Connect takes a play out of the Amazon playbook to make agentic AI the next battleground in retail media
Why Lego turned the Sphere into the Death Star to showcase innovation

linkedinOrgTeaser:
AI agents are now making shopping decisions for consumers. Walmart's Sparky and Amazon's Rufus aren't just chatbots - they're advertising platforms.

But at the same time, brands like Marriott, Starbucks, and Lego are doubling down on human experiences that can't be automated.

Both strategies target the same problem: consumers who've learned to ignore marketing.

Our latest analysis explores what this paradox means for brand partnerships and local activation.

#RetailMedia #AI #BrandPartnerships #Marketing
linkedinPersonalTeaser:
Walmart spent this week announcing AI agents that run ads. Lego spent it turning the Vegas Sphere into a Death Star.

These seem like opposite strategies. They're actually responses to the same problem: consumers who've stopped paying attention to traditional marketing.

One camp bets on automation. The other bets on moments that can't be automated.

What happens when both are right - just for different purchase decisions?
